title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi,

I have an A1502 820-3467-A that has no green light.

PP3V42_G3H = 0.23V
SMC_BC_ACOK = 0.19V
PPBUS_G3H = 0V
PPDCIN_G3H = 19.5V

Couldn't find any short.

Can you help?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Could be D7010 problem; post its voltage.
Also post U7100 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi,
D7010 has 6.69V

U7100:
PIN1= 0v , (but on R7186 CHGR_AGATE is 0V and CHGR_AGATE_DIV is 8V)
2 = 19V
3=4.7V
9=0v
12=0.2v
13=0.1v
14=0.1v
15=0v
17=0v
19=5.4v
20=5.4v
27=19v

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Post U7090 voltages.
Also need diode mode at L7095 and C7090.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
You have practically pure short at 3V42_G3H.
Is safe to inject voltage, no more than 4V.
Start with 1V, increase slowly if needed.
Don't forget to set PSU amp limit to max first.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
It seams that what is shorted (it is what is geting hot)  is the U5000. Does it make sense to you? Should i replace it? 
I only have a 820-4924-A board. Can i use that SMC?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Check if short disappears after U5000 is removed.
You can use 3536 SMC, NOT 4924.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi, the short is gone from  3V42_G3H = 8.40 Kohm.
My problem is that i dont have that SMC to replace. Can you suggest any supplier in Europe?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
I have never bought from EU.
Get scrap boards from China.
Make stock for several models, if you deal with Apple stuff.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Thanks. i'll do that, but i have none for this smc. Already bought a few, but it will take too long to arrive.

Thanks again.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi, The SMC has arrived and i already replaced, but steel no power and no fan spin (already have greenlight).

24 mA on PS

PPBUS_G3H = 12.56V
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING = 12.56 V
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 19v
PP3V42_G3H = 3.4V
PP3V3_S5 = 3.3V
PP1V35_S3  = 0V

Waht should i check from here?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Do you get 3V3_SUS?

Post PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_RSMRST_L and SMC_ONOFF_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L (use R5115/16 pads) and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L, at same time.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi,

3V3_SUS  = 0v

PM_DSW_PWRGD =3.4v
PCH_DSWVRMEN  =3.2v
PM_PWRBTN_L  = 3.4v
PM_RSMRST_L  = 0v
SMC_ONOFF_L  = 3.4 v

I just realise that the Q5480 has burned up, and after removed the pads 3,4 and 5 are missing.

IMG attch

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Made this jumpers. (img attach)
Do you think its safe to power on?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message: It should work, if you rebuilt the traces according to schematic/boardview.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi.

I  Triggered SMC_ONOFF_L (use R5115/16 pads) and had a drop for pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L, at same time , but everything is the same

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
PM_SLP_SUS_L still missing?
If yes, check the 4 PCH's RTC signals.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
PM_SLP_SUS_L  is missing.
I can't figure out where i can measure the 4 PCH RTC signsls. Can you, please, specify where to measure those?

PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 = 0.36v
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.3v
RTC_RESET_L = 3.3v
PPVRTC_G3H= 3.3v

Note sure if this is what you want. Please advise.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Surely not, and we discussed so many times about RTC signals on the forum.
RTC block is clearly delimited inside PCH schematic.
Why did you check ONLY 2 signals, if there appear 4?
I waited to see DC signals, not clock; 2 RTC signals still missing.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
I'm trying to follow...

I think that's it:

PCH_INTRUDER_L = 3
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.3 
RTC_RESET_L = 3.3
PCH_INTVRMEN = 3.2

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
All looks good.

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Post SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE levels.
Also check SMC_DCIN/BMON_ISENSE.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
SMC bypass mode didn't do anything.

SMC_DCIN = 0.03v - 15 M ohm
PBUS_VSENSE  = 0v - 5.4 k ohm
BMON_ISENSE  = 0.06v - 17 M ohm

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Did you get the SMC from 3476 board?
3536 should work too.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
No, i get it from an 820-3536-A. 
Should i replace it for another one?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Should work, be sure to get good solders.
You can try 3476 one, just in case.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message: PM_BATLOW_L?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message: Must be high, once correct charger is detected.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
PM_BATLOW_L is 3.3V on PS.

Can it be relate with Q5480? It burnt as well the test point. Can't the trace be lost somewhere and causing this?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
SMC_PBUS_VSENSE is an important signal for SMC.
If incorrect, machine can only start in SMC bypass.

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
HI, in this case, it doesn't power on in  SMC bypass.

On Q5480 I don't have SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN (0v), and on SMC_PBUS_VSENSE I also have 0V (R5488).
On R5481/2 i have 1V (0.96), and on R5488/9 I have 0V

Can I assume that the problem is on U5000?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
The mentioned sensors are not availble in S5 state.
At least PM_SLP_SUS_L is required for DCIN_VSENSE.
PBUS_VSENSE is available only in S0 state.

Try another SMC...

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi,
Replaced SMC but same result. What else can i check?

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message:
Hi,
just Replaced another SMC today, and it's the same.
No power (consumes 14mA on PSU).

PM_BATLOW_L  = 3.3V
PM_SLP_SUS_L  = 0.0V

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message: Looks like PCH issue then...

title: A1502 820-3467-A no power
message: OK, thanks!
